data.title: Improved gamepad support on windows and linux
data.body:
Uses SDL2 gamepad mappings, supports hot-swapping on windows and fixes some issues like MS$ keyboards being recognized as joysticks on linux. 
It should now also be easy to add support for force-feedback/rumble .

If your gamepad is not in the built-in list, you can add it's mapping via the env variable "SDL_GAMECONTROLLERCONFIG"
Based of punto- 's work in #1464 , thanks for that ;)

Sorry for unnecessary commits, I'm new to git and didn't know about rebase :/

data.title: iPhone platform fixes {resubmit}
data.body:
Hi all, here's the new pull request that doesn't have unecessary commits in it. I've spent time messing with the rebase functionality in order to get it right.

There is a fix in this pull request to get Godot compiling under Msys2 as it was complaining about having too long of an argument list during linkage.

data.title: Configurable debugging information refresh rate
data.body:
Currently, the debugging information (like FPS) updates every second, both in debugger and game. This can make the FPS reporting less accurate.

The refresh rate of debugging information could be configurable in the project settings.

data.title: draw_line() operates on global coords but accepts local coords
data.body:
**Preface:**  
draw_line() and draw_polygon() and draw_circle() do not provide the prettiest. outputs and can cause aliasing.  An attempt to emulate subpixel drawing failed.

**Issue:**  
draw_line() will snap to global coordinates, but accepts local coords.  This can cause some unexpected behavior as lines snap to unexpected coordinates.

**Expected behavior:**  
draw_line() should round() inputs rather than floor() or ceil() them.  Alternatively, if draw_line() is called for width 1 at x = 0.5, two lines are drawn at x=0 and x=1 with alpha of approximately 0.5 \* rgba.  (I personally found alpha of pow( 1 - (x-floor(x)), 2) and pow( 1 - (x-ceil(x)), 2) to be pleasing.)  Using alpha to provide smother draw_polygon() and draw_circle() outputs would also be desired.

**Example**:
    extends Sprite

   set_pos(Vector2(100.1,100)
    var x = 0.5
    draw_line( Vector2(floor(x), 0), Vector2(floor(x), 20) ) # line is drawn at x = 100
    draw_line( Vector2(ceil(x), 0), Vector2(ceil(x), 20) ) # line is drawn at x = 102

![](http://i.imgur.com/Fz1qM2I.png)
**Image explaination:**  
draw_line() is used twice for each 10% interval of the bar length with alpha scaled to represent how close the line is to the floor(x) or ceil(x).  The third line has a 1 pixel gap.

data.title: Spatial editor gizmos are affected by their parent node's scale
data.body:
As the title suggests. Icons for 3D light nodes appear at a fixed, huge size.

Build is latest from git.

![huge_light_icon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3391055/11169791/098d83ba-8bc2-11e5-83e2-415650ebf4f6.png)

data.title: Crash - if() in Shader crashes when ";" is typed after ()
data.body:
How to reproduce:
Create project with for example TestCube (also works with Polygon2D).
Assign text based shader material.
Type this "shader" into Shader Editor:
float x=1;
if(x=1);

What happens: crash :)

data.title: .net coreclr / corefx
data.body:
Hi,
i wonder if u may put .net on your roadmap,
in my opinion c# would open godot to a wide range of hobby coders
and maybe some ppl will come from unity :)
afaik u havent done it yet because mono has license issues.
but have u tracked the "new" microsoft ideas, coreclr / corefx ?
these are open source and "platform independent"
also they planning "net native" (https://msdn.microsoft.com/de-de/vstudio/dotnetnative.aspx) which will be able to compile c# "like" c++
sure far from working but an intresting thing...

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer is unable to fire function from AnimationPlayer
data.body: AnimationTreePlayer is unable de call a function from Animations in AnimationPlayer.

data.title: Load binaryname.pck
data.body: in linux and windows if not found data.pck , search for binaryname.pck and load that.

data.title: Builtin libpng is outdated
data.body: Current version of bundled libpng is [1.5.4](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/png/png.h#L4), and is most likely affected by [CVE 2015-8126](https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2015-8126), email available [here](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/11/12/2).

data.title: Added selection menu to spatial and canvas editors
data.body:
Feature requested in #837
##### Still missing:
- [x] Sort selection results in canvas editor by Z.
- [ ] Maya navigation scheme support in spatial editor.

**Key combination:** _Alt_ + _Right Click_
##### Screenshots:

![Spatial editor Screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/11166015/b888e292-8b22-11e5-96af-e31f48abed1c.png)
![Canvas editor Screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/11166012/85573acc-8b22-11e5-845c-f214acb5c348.png)

data.title: Activate PopupMenu items with middle and right click
data.body: This is the default behaviour in most applications. Right/middle clicking on a popup menu item gives the same result as left clicking it.

data.title: Skip META-INF from Android Template
Shader lang API in Help tab
data.body:
It would be nice to make section for Shader lang in our Help tab, listing built-in variables, functions and maybe also datatypes.

Currently user can find info about it only on wiki.

data.title: "Revert Scene" does nothing.
data.body:
The Scene > Revert Scene option seems to not work anymore.
If I make a trivial change in a scene (such as hiding an element) and try to revert, it'll make no change, leaving the hidden element still hidden. There isn't much to say, no visible errors or anything, the scene just doesn't revert. 
Seems some others have encountered this problem, but since there was no open issue, better to have it here.

Using latest trunk version, on Ubuntu 15.10 64b.

data.title: steam_api is not work when use lib crypto in Linux
data.body:
I write steam api module,
When I run Godot app with Steam client open the app is terminate, message in console show:
`Segmentation fault (core dumped)`

It because importing lib crypto, I must set `openssl=no` when use scons compile for resolve it.

In Windows it has no problem.

data.title: Builtin OpenSSL is outdated
data.body:
The version of the builtin openssl is [1.0.1h](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/1d7e9c4ba52250db3b0b0fd732e44074252045d2/drivers/builtin_openssl2/openssl/opensslv.h#L32), which fortunately isn't affected by heartbleed anymore, but still outdated. The most recent version is `1.0.1p`.

For the longer term, I think that it would be great if openssl could be updated to the most recent version for every stable release of godot.

data.title: Change popup_menu.cpp to deselect on .clear
data.body: This is a fix for #2011 , and applies the "patch" given there.

data.title: convert xml scenes to scn at compile time
data.body: I would like if the scenes were created in XML and converted to automatic scn at compile time  as gd and gdc

data.title: GDScript: Allow extending directly from Object
data.body:
Currently in GDScript, inheriting is only possible from file classes and other classes inheriting from Object.
This change allows inheriting directly from Object:

```
extends Object

var value

func _init():
    value = 2
```

data.title: Remove of use_exclude_ctrl_bones (was removed in io_scene_dae by Serg
data.body: ey Lapin, commit 4210d5e4594fcf80bc121bccc916d411663d02bc) in godot_export_manager.py

data.title: HTML5: No Release Export available
data.body:
Currently it is only possible to export the debug version which includes the debugging console and emscripten logo inside the web page. The export option "enable debugging" doesn't do anything.

So I pledge for adding a release export template which only shows the actual game without anything else.

data.title: Add option to disable colours in terminal output
data.body: I don't have a use case for this personally, but a couple contributors asked me about it after I made #2737 (though I did not add colouring, just improved it), so filing this in a separate issue.

data.title: Button node - additional properties for the icon
data.body:
- icon separation
- modulate icon
  ![godot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3484686/11093940/3c23972a-888d-11e5-8135-d691aaf5f815.jpg)

data.title: Ability to edit Editor Settings from Project Manager
data.body: It's a bummer that you have to open a project in order to edit the Editor Settings, since they're not related to any project.

data.title: Implement Quat multiply operator, and bind xform method
data.body:
Implement missing script multiplication operator of `Quat` with a `Quat` and `Quat` with a `Vector3` and bind `xform` method of Quat class.

Fixes #1996

data.title: Implement Ctrl + backspace/delete to delete words
data.body:
I've used Alt + backspace/delete to delete words if the APPLE_STYLE_KEYS flag enabled, but i done this based on the rest of code, i can change this if is not right.

Fixes #284.

data.title: Search and/or filter for Project and Editor settings
data.body:
The list size in the Project Settings panel is quite long and so it is in the Editor Settings too. It would be nice to have a way to filter and or search them.

Pretty much the same reason as #2176.

data.title: Fix node renaming bug when using the '.' character
data.body:
Fixed by making '.' (and '/') illegal character in node names when adding via the rename feature.

Based off #503 by @sanikoyes with some cosmetic fixes + removal of a `_TR()` function that we don't support.
